misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that all input resources, including the global standard input stream (`System.in`), must be explicitly closed via the `Scanner.close()` method to avoid resource leaks.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: The student fails to distinguish between managing external file or network resources (which must be closed) and the static, global standard input stream (`System.in`). Closing a `Scanner` connected to `System.in` also closes the underlying stream, preventing any subsequent code in the JVM process from ever reading from standard input again. Standard input is a persistent resource managed by the operating system/JVM, not a temporary file that needs explicit release.
